column4: I am trying to update to this one driver I have on my desktop
it's called NVIDIA-Linux-x86-180.51-pkg1.run
how do I do that?
the Nvidia site said to simply run sh [file name]
so what do I need to do?
I type that all on one line, correct?
it loaded a bit then said "E: couldn't find package linux-headers-uname -r
I just installed my Creative X-Fi
wait what?
I was replying to pw-toxic
can you  hear sound with your x-fi at the moment?
I think I had that, what you have to do is once you install the drivers, select your sound card from the preferences>sound menu
maybe i misunderstood you, but i just told you that i tried the "test" button of the "preferences->sound" interface
correct, I had that same error
and how did you fix it? ;)
but there is one very important point: i need to set all sound with low frequency to my subwoofer...  is there a possibliity to do this?
i have no bass at all ;(
do you know if there is 5.1 support with the linux driver of x-fi?
german ubuntu forum says "no 5.1" ;(  it it seems that creative wont release further versions to support it ;(  damnit... do you know a good soundcard with 5.1 with good drivers and some options?
anyway .. i watch blue rays and it is nearly impossible to watch real blue rays on linux (its possible.. but hard to achieve)
so i will always need windows xp ;//
but i can play world of warcraft and poker on ubuntu ;))
do you have any experience with a microphone using your x-fi under ubuntu?
